items.title: Lake Rabun Hotel
items.description: Lake Rabun Hotel & Restaurant celebrated its 90th birthday in 2012. It’s the last surviving mountain lodge on a lake in Georgia. Because it has stayed true to the look and the feeling of another, perhaps more peaceful, time, it’s been called both a regional and a national treasure.  For decades generations have enjoyed the beauty of the lake and mountains. Carefully restored by preservationists in 2008 to maintain its ancestral charm, it features gardens of native plants, rock pillars and walkways, locust log decks, and balconies with views of the surrounding Blue Ridge Mountains. Lake Rabun is one of the most beautiful lakes in the mountains of North Georgia.

items.title: Fish Camp
items.description: Stay in a peaceful, quiet setting tucked away in the woods not far from Lake Rabun hotel, Lakemont historic art village, and the idyllic Lake Rabun itself. We’re happy to offer you our new services at the fish camp: The setting is camp style with 5 cottages spaciously separated from each other and a central communal fire pit area. Three of these are charmingly renovated 2 bedroom cottages with private decks. Two more cottages will be renovated in the winter and will feature free standing fireplaces.
